intro: Fagonia jolyi var. stenophylla, commonly known as the narrow-leaf fagonia, is a shrub native to arid and semi-arid regions of the Middle East and Central Asia. It is characterized by its small, narrow leaves and yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant is adapted to withstand drought conditions, with deep roots and a waxy leaf coating to reduce water loss. It belongs to the family Capparaceae and is often found in rocky or sandy soils. Its botanical features make it a resilient plant in harsh environments.
